article.headline: VCU 79, N.C.-Wilmington 70
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Joey Rodriguez scored 25 points as Virginia Commonwealth won its ninth consecutive game, beating North Carolina-Wilmington 79-70 Saturday night. Rodriguez made two 3-pointers, and Ed Nixon and Bradford Burgess each hit one as the Rams (18-5, 10-1 Colonial Athletic Association) built a 15-5 lead less than 5 minutes into the game. They led by at least six the rest of the first half, which ended with the Rams ahead 42-31. The Rams widened their lead to 17 points, 67-50, with 8:27 to go before the Seahawks (10-12, 4-7) began to whittle it down. After making 10 of 20 first-half shots from 3-point range, VCU was 1 of 9 outside the arc in the second. Bradford finished with 17 points and Nixon 16 for the Rams, who have won 22 straight at home. Trevor Deloach scored 20 points, Chad Tomko 15 and Ahmad Grant 14 for UNC Wilmington, which committed 18 turnovers to the Rams' eight.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
